Fish Fry

Coriander Pdr 10 Grams 
Chillipowder 5 Grams 
Gingergarlic Paste 10 Grams 
Oil 10 ml 
Coriander Leaves 1 Springs 
Turmeric 1 Pinch 
Chopped Chilles 1 Piece 
Fish 4 Piece 
Curry Leaves 1 Springs 
Lemon Juice 5 Piece
marinate fish with all the ingredients and cook on medium heat both the sides.
coconut shrimp prawn fry

Desicated Cocnut 10 Grams 
Curry Leaves 1 Springs 
Coriander Leaves 1 Springs 
Chillipowder 1 Pinch 
All Purpose Flour 1 Pinch 
Turmeric 1 Pinch 
Salt 1 Pinch 
Shrimp 8 Numbers 
Egg 1 Teaspoons 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Teaspoons
1.mix all ingredient and marinate the shrimpcoat the shrimp with beaten eggdip in coconut and allpurpose mixture and fry as shown serve hot with chilli sauce
Goan Shrimp curry

Shrimp 500 Grams 
Grated Coconuts 1 Cup 
Onion 1 
Green Chilli 3 Numbers 
Red Chilli And Cumin Seeds Soked 2 Numbers 
Salt as per taste 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Garamasala Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Turmeric Powder pinch 
Pepper Powder as per taste 
Sugar pinch 
Chopped Tomatoes 2 Numbers 
Coriander Leaves 1 Bunch 
Mustard Seeds pinch 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Whole Garamasala Dry 2 Numbers

1.heat oil in a heavy pan add garam masala whole ,add chopped onions ,salt and cook till they are golden brown\n2. add turmeric, ginger garlic paste and the ground mixture ground mixture-red chilli and cumin soaked in vinegar and warm water(little) chopped tomatoes,grated coconut,mustard shrimp and make fine paste add coriander pdr , pepper pdr and cook till oil ozzes out\n3. add water to the consistency of the gravy you need and add shrimp and cook for 7-10 min add pinch of sugar add gr chillies and check seasoning finish off with coriander leaves enjoy with a bowl of rice
Crab Curry

Coconut Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Coriander Pwd 1 Tablespoons 
Red Chilli Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Salt 
Gingergarlic Paste 
Turmuric 
Oil 2 Tablespoons 
Green Chillies 4 Numbers 
Tomatoes 2 Numbers 
Onion 1 large Numbers 
Crad 1000 Grams 
Poppy Seeds 1 Tablespoons 
Cumin Seeds Pwd 1/2 Teaspoons 
Garamasala Pwd pinch 
CORIANDER LEAVES 1 Springs

1.Cut onions green chillies, tomatoes and make into a paste. \n2.Take a pan add oil, onion paste, turmuric, ginger garlic paste, salt mix well cook till it becomes thick now add, red chilli pwd, coriander pwd, cumin pwd, coconut and poppy seeds pwd or paste mix well then add the crab pieces and cook for 3-5 min then add water and cover with lid and cook till the cards are done or you cook in pressure cooker. \n3.once it is done add garamasala pwd, coriander chopped mix well.
rispy Fried Shrimp - Prawns with Shell on

Gingergarlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Turmuric pinch 
Red Chilli Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Salt as per taste 
Pepper Pwd 1/2 Teaspoons 
Cornflour 1 Tablespoons 
Coconut Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Oil to fry 
Prawns 500 Grams 
Water little

1.Take prawns with shell and slit at the back and cut the sharp edges and wash it.\n2. Now in a bowl add coconut pwd, cornflour, red chilli pwd, pepper pwd, salt, turmuric, gingergarlic paste, mix well aby adding little bit water and add prawns mix well and keep a side for 15-30 min and then deep fry it till golden in colour.
Pearl spot - karimeen fry kerala style

Lime Juice 1/2 Numbers 
Coriander Pwd 1 Tablespoons 
Maida 1 Tablespoons 
Cornflour 1 Tablespoons 
Garamasala Pwd Kerala pinch 
Gingergarlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Turmuric pinch 
Salt as per taste 
Red Chilli Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Oil to fry 
Karimeen Fish 2 Numbers 
Curry Leaves 1 Springs 
CORIANDER LEAVES 1 Springs

1.Take fish clean and slit both the side of the fish and also stomach Now take a bowl add red chilli pwd,salt,turmuric,gingergarlic paste, coriander pwd, lime juice mix well and divide into two parts In one part for pan fry add coriander leaves, curry leaves finely chopped, and maida mix well and apply to the fish on the both sides, into the cuts, stomach and keep a side for 15-30 min and then pan fry by adding oil till golden in colour .\n2. Now in another part add cornflour mix well the apply to the fish on both the sides and rest for 15-30min and deep fry the fish till golden in colour.
Prawns - Shrimp cooked in sour greens gongura

Turmuric pinch 
Onion Chopped 1 Numbers 
Murstard pinch 
Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Salt as needed 
Green Chillies 6 Numbers 
Gongura 2 Bunch 
Shrimp 500 Grams 
Gingergarlic Paste 1/2 Teaspoons 
Coriander Pwd 1 Teaspoons 
Cumin Seeds Pwd 1/2 Teaspoons 
Garamasala pinch

1.Take a pan heat oil, green chillies, gongura leaves mix well and cook well and once it is done make into a paste and keep a side.\n2. Now in the same pan add oil, murstard seeds, chopped onion, salt, once onions are olden in colour add turmuric, ginger garlic paste, coriander pwd, cumin pwd, and shrimp mix well let it cook for few min.\n3. Then add the paste of gongura, garamasala mix well and cook till the shirmp is done.
Mahi Pakoda

Salt To Taste 
Coriander Leaves 1 Springs 
Beasan 2 Tablespoons 
Red Chilli Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Lime 1 Numbers 
Sesame Seeds 1 Teaspoons 
Bread Crumbs 1/2 Cup 
Sabudana Papad 1 Numbers 
Ajwain 1 Pinch 
Baking Pdr 1/4 Numbers 
Deboned Fish Pieces 250 Grams 
Oil To Fry

1.Clean the fish pieces
2.Mix all the ingredients
3.Marinate the fish pieces with the mixture 
4. apply coating as desired
5.Deep fry till golden brown 
6.Serve hot with sauce and lime
Fish Fingers

Fish 500 Grams 
Basen ( Channa Dal Powder) 2 Tablespoons 
Turmuric pinch Pinch 
Red Chillie Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Garama Masala 3/4 Teaspoons 
Coriander Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Cumin Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1/2 Teaspoons
Curry Leaves 7 Numbers 
Lemon 1 Numbers 
Salt as per taste 
Bread Crums 2 Tablespoons

1.Take fish add lime juice,salt,turmeric,chilli powder,garam masala,coriander powder,cumin,chopped curry leaves,ginger garlic paste mix all these well.Now mix basin and bread crumbs in a plate dip the fish into it and remove.\n2.Take a pan add oil for frying, once oil get heated add some of the fish pieces and deep fry till they turn into golden brown in color.Remove it and squeeze little lime juice.
Golden Fried Prawns

Green Chilly Sauce 1 Tablespoons 
Sugar 1 Tablespoons 
Corn Flour 2 Tablespoons 
Beaten Egg 1 Numbers 
Refined Flour 3 Tablespoons 
Prawns 6 Numbers 
Baking Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Oil For Cooking 
Salt To Taste

1. Make a paste of red chilly which is soaked in vinegar, Add the red chilly paste and Garlic,Sugar,tomato ketchup,lemon juice,2 tbs of vinegar and mix it up and pinch of salt till every thing gets completely mixed up.\n2. FOR THE BATTER: Take egg add pinch of sugar, salt and chilly sauce add some ice chilled water and whisk them in this add one tbs of oil, cornflower and pinch of baking powder,all purpose powder and mix it up make thick batter and rest of 15 minutes. First devine the prawns, 3. take the prawn but tail on dip it in the batter Leaving the tail by deep fry till it is Golden colored,\n4. Serving it with your favorite sauce or sweet Garlic sauce.
Fish In Garlic Sauce

Salt To Taste 
Jaggery 1/4 Cup 
Tomato Ketchup 2 Tablespoons 
Chilly Sauce 1 Tablespoons 
Onion 1 Numbers 
Chopped Ginger 1 Teaspoons 
Chopped Garlic 1 Teaspoons 
Oil 3 Tablespoons 
Vinegar 2 Tablespoons 
Soya Sauce 2 Tablespoons 
Fish 1 Numbers 
Fish Stock 1 Cup 
Lemon Juice 2 Tablespoons

1. Take fish make gashes on both sides. Take a bowl add Soya sauce, vinegar, mixes it and pour the sauce on the fish, after marinating for 15 minutes sprinkle the corn flour and dredge it.\n2. Heat oil in a pan add fish; cook in a slow flam. Take another pan heat oil add chopped garlic,chopped ginger, slices of onions, add chilly sauce, Soya sauce, tomato ketchup, add jaggery, salt, lemon juice, add fish stock, add white of spring onions.\n3. Take the sauce and pour it on the fried fish.
Massaged and Stuffed Indian Mackerel

Boiled Rice 1/2 Cup 
Raw Mango Pieces 1/2 Cup 
Chilly Flakes 1 Teaspoons 
Coriander Powder 2 Tablespoons 
Cumin Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Ginger 1 small Piece 
Onion Shallots 6 Numbers 
Fish 500 Grams 
Lemon Juice 1 Tablespoons 
Salt To Taste 
Egg 1 Numbers 
All Purpose Flour 1 Cup

1. First cut and clean up the fish and massage the fish on the bone on both sides, this will loosen the bone and take out the bone.\n2. For stuffing: Shallots, ginger, crushed in a mortar pestle, Take a bowl and add crushed ginger, onion shallots, and cumin powder, coriander powder, chilly flakes, salt, and add raw mango and boiled rice crush the ingredients and add chopped coriander, lemon juice, and add Â½ egg and mix it well.\n3. And stuff the masala in to the fish and coat the fish with all purpose flour and shallow fry them.
Spicy Tangy Prawns Kerala Style

Tomato 2 Numbers 
Curry Leaves 6 Numbers 
Onions Chopped 2 Numbers 
Mustard Seeds 1 Teaspoons 
Ginger, Garlic 1 Tablespoons 
Turmeric 1/4 Teaspoons 
Fenugreek Seeds 1/2 Teaspoons 
Pepper Corn 1 Tablespoons 
Coriander Seeds 1 Tablespoons 
Whole Red Chilly 5 Numbers 
Prawns 250 Grams 
Green Chilly 3 Numbers 
Kokum 2 Numbers 
Oil 2 Tablespoons

1. Take a pan add whole red chilly, coriander seeds, pepper corn, fenugreek seeds, and dry roast the ingredients in a slow flame, add garlic, ginger, and put it in the blender make a fine paste.
2. Heat oil in a pan add mustard seeds, chopped onions, salt, curry leaves, cooks these onions till brown colour. 
3. In this add made masala, turmeric, cook it for few minutes, then add tomatoes, put the lid and cook for 4 minutes. 
4. Add green chilly, kokum, then add prawns and add coconut milk mix it well and cook for 2 minutes, switch off the flame.
5. Serve this hot with rice.
Dry Prawns With Tomato Masala

Red Chilly Powder 2 Tablespoons 
Tomatoes Chopped 3 Numbers 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Turmeric 1/4 Teaspoons 
Oil 3 Tablespoons 
Salt To Taste 
Onions Chopped 1 Numbers 
Whole Garam Masala (all) 1 Numbers 
Ridge Gourd (luffa) 150 Grams 
Dry Prawns 75 Grams 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Tamarind Juice 1/2 Cup 
Garam Masala 1 Tablespoons 
Coriander Leaves 1 Bunch

1. Heat oil in pan add dry prawns (soaked in the water for 1 minute) and fry them and take it aside,
2. In the same oil add whole garam masala, chopped onions; cook these onions till golden color.
3. Add ginger garlic paste, turmeric, add chopped tomatoes, salt, coriander powder, red chilly powder, mix it up and lid on cook for few minutes.
4. In this add ridge gourd, tamarind juice, water, put the lid on cook for 5 minutes, after 5 minutes add dry prawns, and cover it, let it cook for1 minutes in a slow flame.
5. After 2 minute switch off the flame, Add garam masala, coriander leaves.
6. Serve this hot with rice.
Apollo Fish Fry

Curry Leaves 2 Springs 
Green Chilly Chopped 3 Numbers 
Oil For Deep Fry 
Chopped Ginger Garlic 1 Teaspoons
Turmeric 1 Pinch 
Chilly Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Egg 1 Numbers 
All Purpose Flour 1 Tablespoons 
Corn Starch 1 Tablespoons 
Murrel Fish 250 Grams 
Chilly Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Salt To Taste 
Soya Sauce 1 Teaspoons 
Curd 1/4 Cup 
Peppers Crush 1/2 Teaspoons 
Lime Juice 1 Tablespoons

1.Take bowl add Murrel fish pieces, add salt, ginger garlic paste, chilly powder, turmeric, mix it well, add egg, corn starch, all purpose flour, mix this well and deep fry them, keep it aside.\n2. Heat oil in a pan add chopped ginger and garlic, green chilly, curry leaves, chilly paste, coriander powder, salt, soya sauce (optional), curd, crush pepper powder, chopped coriander leaves, cook this some time and add fried fish toss it and add lime juice.
Fish Makhani

Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Whole Garam Masala (each) 4 Grams 
Tomatoes 500 Grams 
Kasoori Methi Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Butter 1/4 Cup 
Salt To Taste 
Green Chilly 25 Grams 
Kashmiri Red Chilly 75 Grams 
Cashew Nuts 50 Grams 
Onions 150 Grams 
Sugar 1 Teaspoons 
Fish small fillets 
Chilly Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Coriander Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
All Purpose Flour 1 Teaspoons 
Lime Juice 1 Teaspoons 
Cream 1 Teaspoons

1.Add whole garam masala in the muslin cloth and tie it .Heat butter in a pressure cooker and put the garam masala sachet in it, add onions cashew nuts, sautÃ© it for 5 minutes, then add salt, ginger garlic paste, cook this till raw flavour is gone. Add colour giving chilli or Kashmiri red chilly, green chilly, tomatoes, mix it well and put the lid on and let it cook for 15 to 20 minutes in a slow flame (5 to 6 whistles). \n2.Let it cool down, remove the sachet and using strainer drain out the water and put the onion and tomato into the blender and blend them and make a paste and again strain it, after straning all, discard the seeds and peels of tomato. Cook the strained paste of tomatoes and onions for 20 minutes then add salt, sugar as required , mix it and add toasted kasoori methi (cursh it with hands) once it comes to boil switch off the flame.\n3. Take fish pieces in a plate and sprinkle chilly powder, coriander powder, salt and all purpose flour, squeeze the lime juice and coat the masala on both sides of the fish, heat butter in a pan add marinated fish and shallow fry them and add makhani gravy cook this along with fish and add cream mix it and serve this with saffron rice.
Shrimp with Mustard Sauce

Red Chilly Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Turmeric 1/4 Teaspoons 
Green Chilly 3 Numbers 
Garlic Chopped 1 Teaspoons 
Mustard Oil 2 Tablespoons 
Mustard Paste 2 Tablespoons 
Salt To Taste 
Shrimp 150 Grams 
Sugar 1/2 Teaspoons

1. Take mustard seeds soak it into the water for 6 hours and make a paste keep it aside. Heat mustard oil in a pan add chopped garlic, green chilly, turmeric, red chilly paste, mustard paste, salt, shrimp mix it well.\n2. cook in a slow flame for 3 to 4 minutes, sprinkle sugar.
Grilled Shrimp on Sugarcane

Jaggery 1 Teaspoons 
Chopped Onion 2 Numbers 
Chopped Garlic 1 Teaspoons 
Egg 1 Numbers 
Fish Sauce 1 Tablespoons 
Corn Flour 1 Tablespoons 
Salt To Taste 
Pepper Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Coriander Leaf 1 Bunch 
Spring Onions 1/2 Cup 
Shrimp 350 Grams 
Lime Rind 1/4 Teaspoons 
Bread Crumb 2 Tablespoons

1. Take a bowl add rind the lime, spring onions, coriander leaf, pepper powder, salt, corn flour, fish sauce.
2. Add shrimp and egg, transfer this into food processor and process make a coarse paste transfer this in a bowl, in this add finely chopped garlic, chopped onions, jaggery,
3. mix it and add bread crumb(optional), mix well, Cut the sugarcane lengthwise into thin sticks, and apply shrimp mixture to make kabobs
4. Heat oil in griddle and fry kabobs on all sides,
